I think I have just the right recommendations for you!

If you enjoyed the depth and biographical elements of "Man on the Moon", I highly recommend "The Pursuit of Happyness". This inspiring true story follows Chris Gardner, a struggling salesman turned stockbroker, as he navigates the challenges of single fatherhood and professional pursuits. With an outstanding performance by Will Smith, this film is sure to resonate with you.

If you're in the mood for something lighter but still with a strong narrative thread, "Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid" might be just what you need! This classic Western comedy stars Paul Newman and Robert Redford as two outlaws on the run, bringing plenty of humor and adventure to the table.

I think you might enjoy "The Social Network"! It's a fascinating story about the creation of Facebook and the struggles that come with success, all set against the backdrop of Harvard University. Plus, Jesse Eisenberg's portrayal of Mark Zuckerberg is both impressive and relatable.

If you're in the mood for something a bit more historical and action-packed, "Rob Roy" could be an excellent choice! It's a thrilling tale of revenge and redemption set in 18th-century Scotland, with Liam Neeson delivering a strong performance as the titular character.
